dialogues.text: Ella reaches the CELLAR DOOR with Emmett. LOCKED. Sees a HATCHET in a stump -- rips it out and HAMMERS the lock to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone inside! GO GO GO!! Ushering Emmett and TOWNSFOLK underground, PULLS the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE stumbles up... as a speeder FIRES A RING AT HIM. But reflexively, his WRIST WEAPON FIRES ANOTHER BLAST, vapori it! He looks down at the blaster: "Hell y ." Another speeder circles around -- KABOOM! The blaster's incredible firepower SPIRALS THE SPEEDER OUT OF CONTROL,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speeder PLOWS through, parishioners flee -- the CHURC breaks from the BELL TOWER -- CRASHES DOWN ON THE SPEEDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake keeps FIRING, the last speeders turn tail and RET disappearing back INTO THE TORNADO as the cloud overhead UP and INHALES the swirling mass, which spirals to the he ... GONE. The massive cloud seems to VAPORIZE and the DES SUN returns... debris flutters... smoke clears... And all... is... STILL. As our CAMERA RISES to reveal... HALF THE BUILDINGS HAVE SUCKED INTO THE SKY.
From the rubble, SURVIVORS EMERGE: EMMETT and ELLA from t cellar with inhabitants. DOLARHYDE. DOC. Al in SHOCK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria -- oh God-- they t-took her-- What just...? MOANS, WAILS... desperate cries as people search for love JAKE'S BLASTER -- RETRACTS, folding in on itself -- shrin to size, reverting back into a BRACELET. He's stunned. So the remaining townsfolk. DOLARHYDE is first to speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell're ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the one who caged Percy. Dolarhyde starts MOVING toward Jake -- wild killer eyes -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatwere__tho_se__thinae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- why're you asking m&?! Dolarhyde GRIPS Jake's arm -- THE BRACELET:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This! Where'd you get this?! It was shooting the same light beams they were --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of my wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm not lettin' go of nothin' til you tell me what the he-- KA-LLLANG!! Suddenly that CHURCH BELL comes HURTLING out church wreckage, PLOWS through debris. People scatter. An of the church stumbles... AN ALIEN. 8 FT. TALL. Standing upright, limbs inverted -- limbs that DRAG, wounded, as people SCREAM and RUN and Ja Dolarhyde can only stare, jaws dropped, and the monster L WHUPWHUP -- something SPINNING through the air -- A HATCH

dialogues.speaker: SCHLUCK
dialogues.text: ELLA, hang iust hurled it. The alien lets out a DEATH RAT then FALLS FORWARD, the hatchet embedding deeper as it HI DIRT. Holy SHIT.

Ella's adrenaline dynamo starts to die down, replaced now SHOCK. And for what seems like the first time, FEAR. She EXHALES a crazy breath, stumbles back... as slowly... peo converge around the corpse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it... dead? Jake KICKS the alien. It doesn't move. Happy BARKS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . The hell j,,a it?

dialogues.speaker: MEACHAM, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: A demon. They all turn to see MEACHAM. TERRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revelations 16:14: "For there are spirits of demons, showing signs." (points to the alien) Escaped from hell itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit its wrist! It's got one'a those bracelet things too! Indeed, there on the creature's wrist is an IDENTICAL BRA ON JAKE. Mind tumbling. He meets eyes with ELLA. Her face EAGER as his to understand this and now... BEEP. BEEP. BE What's that SOUND? Everyone looks at each other. Colorado bends closer to the corpse... SCARED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... it's comin' from somewhere inside it. People look at each other: WHAT NOW? Trying to control th hysteria they all feel. Finally, Dolarhyde takes a BREATH more BRAVADO than actual courage:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out. We need to cut it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a doctor. Got a bone saw? DOC snaps out of his stupor, looks up, FREAKED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Are you... serious? (looks to them all)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake u Those things took your wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this one here's our only chance of findin' where they went. That LANDS on all of them. A long beat. Doc looks down at thing, ORANGE GOO dribbling around the AXE in its head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got a bone saw or don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! The alien corpse is DROPPED onto the bar by Doc and Meacham. As Dolarhyde and Colorado follow through the bat -- Doc WHIPS a SHOTGUN from under the bar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay outside. You're not welcome in here! Dolar brings up his COLT -- so does COLORADO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I own more of this town than any man in it so I'll go wherever the hell I damn please. And for the record? You ain't welcome in my country, Mexican. Ella steps between them, BAD ASS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever troubles you had don't mean a damn thing against the ones we got now. We wanna see our way through 'em, your guns better start pointing in the same direction, Goddammit. Doc and Dolar never take eyes off each other. or their GU Finally... Dolar LOWERS his. So does Doc. People BREATHE. Meacham slips on a pair of GLASSES, studying eerie veins muscles through the creature's viscous outer layers. Doc his focus to the alien too. Picks up his PUMP-OPERATED BO SAW. Presses his boot on the bellows, it turns with a WHI SHAKING as he brings the SPINNING BLADE to the alien's CH Looks at Meacham, AFRAID --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it 'mss a demon, and I cut it open... am I going to burn for it?
Meacham hesitates a beat, then CROSSES the air in front o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should cover ya. ON DOC. Little relief. BROW SWEATING, he brings the spinn blade down toward the disgusting ALIEN -- VRRRRZZ -- HESI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. B GH! He PUKES on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Doc!!! Doc wipes his mouth with a handkerchief, slightly DEFIANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not normal. I'm entitled to vomit. We should XU be vomiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cut, Lardass. Doc GLARES... with a still-shakitig hand, gets back to bu

dialogues.speaker: VRRRRZ
dialogues.text: and... SHUNK! Doc looks up at Jake, gestures to the carca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor? A hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, maricon. The men all grip the chest plate and PULL -- A DISGUSTING Everyone turns away, scowling, Emmett wafting the air:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! Smells like a dead dog's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emmett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Father. Doc covers his face with his handkerchief as he explores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chet wall's partially collapsed... no familiar organs of any kind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'course they're not familiar. Just look at this th--

SUDDENLY THE ALIEN'S ARM LASHES OUT -- claws SNAP OPEN an Dolarhyde against the wall! Everyone tries to PRY the cla from his neck -- but the second Doc withdraws his hands f alien's chest, its arm goes LIMP. Dolarhyde drops, GASPIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinal reflex. And GRINS at Dolar's pain. But Meacham NOTICES something Dolar's neck where the alien pinned him, like a ring of D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something on your neck. Hold still. Meacham sweeps a little off Dolar's neck, rubs it between and forefinger. The dust GLINTS under the kerosene lamp:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned... gold. They check the creature's hand talons: GOLD FLAKES undern 'em, and Lots of it. Colorado checks its taloned feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here too. (looks to Dolar) This much ore... could only have come from a digging in a mine. That LANDS on everyone. but most especially ELLA. Who loo to see Jake READING her in this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ALIEN'S EYE is a SMALL FLASHING LIGHT. On/Off/On/O time with that BEEP BEEP BEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme my scalpel. In MACRO CU, DOC CUTS INTO THE EYE, WET SQUISHY SOUNDS as pulls it from its socket, attached to a STRINGY OPTIC NER dripping with juice. Clamped to the nerve is a METALLIC O -- he takes hold of the blinking orb. It FLARES to life, light coalescing into a 3-D ARROW-LIKE HOLOGRAM. Confusio Doc REMOVES it from the optic nerve and the hologram DISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd it go? The hell'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, just pulled it off -- He reconnects it to the optic nerve, the hologram REAPPEA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only works when it's touching the creature. Colorado moves closer... rainbow light flickering across face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... it's a compass. Look: (fiddles with tweezers) No matter how you move it, it points in the same direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Compasses point north. That's west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing; to Jake) West's where 141 came from. ON JAKE. Another puzzle piece falling into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're right, what's it pointing to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that's where I'm goin'. He SNAPS his PISTOL open, loading bullets:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my ranchers said my herd disappeared into the sky. 'Til about ten minutes ago, I figured him for a liar. (SNAPS barrel closed) Nobody takes my cattle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your b was taken too. A FLASH of something from Dolarhyde -- could that be EMOT But just as fast, it's GONE. Almost a THROWAWAY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they're already dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid's right. If all they wanted was to kill us, they would've.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looked to me like... they were ropin' people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means they need 'em for something. Whatever it is, we can either stand here guessin'... or go find out. His eyes flash to Nat: "C'mon." And they EXIT. Everyone l at each other, working up the courage to face what they k they must. Doc grabs his SHOTGUN, starts gathering shells

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's alive -- if there's even a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord hates a coward... but our bullets were useless against those things. Other than his wrist gizmo, we're outgunned and outnumbered. As one by one, they turn... to JAKE. Who until this point been mostly SILENT. Observing. But now -- he's gone from to potential savior in a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, I got nothing to do with this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got everything to do with it. If you can remember where you got that thing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you all wantin' me on the end of a damned rope. Whatever's happenin' here's got nothin' to do with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure. about that? He LOOKS at her. No, he isn't. But he sure as hell won't to debate it -- turns to go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lonergan? Sir? The EMOTION in the boy's voice STOPS Jake at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother died last year. My Paw... he's all I got.
And despite a fleeting moment of SYMPATHY, Jake darkens -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, I'm the last man you want anywhere near you, your Pa... or anyone else in this goddamned town. OUT the door. Everyone trades looks, then Ella FOLLOWS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake moves FAST past blown-out STOREFRONTS as Ella PURSUE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? You're just gonna run away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Sister. I'm walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well s w. As he keeps on walking, Ella picks up a ROCK, wings it at back of his HEAD -- WHAMI Jake stumbles forward, TURNS AR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONOVA-- -- I told you to gyp. Ella strides forward, picking up another rock on the move

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your damn problem?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're comin' with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming anywhere. And you throw that rock I swear I'll-- WHAM! The rock glances off his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're walkin' away from here, what the hell're you walking tsQ? That PENETRATES as Jake realizes he doesn't really KNOW. that's the last thing he's gonna admit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you walkin' to, Lady? 'Cause if I heard right, it sounds like suicide to me. -- now it's her turn to pause. Cryptically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... just wanna help these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You wanna help yourself. Saw your face light up the minute you knew that thing might lead you to gold. And the fact that he's BUSTED her gets Ella's hackles up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gold I want, you dumb sonofabitch, it's what it'll buy me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remange. Whatever that means, it's a deep, painful LONGING in her. stares at him, DEAD ON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lookin' at you? I'd bet a silver dollar... its what you want, too. With that, Ella turns and STRIDES OFF as we HOLD ON JAKE, knotted in conflict. As her words RESONATE.

dialogues.speaker: MEACHAM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Was the Devil come to Absolution... come to drag our town down to hell... SERIES OF SHOTS - AS DUSK TAI .t $. TQ .NIGItT: Though BURNING EMBERS, Emmett helps a LITTLE GIRL pull he burnt DOLL from the rubble...

dialogues.speaker: MEACHAM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: but our town's not just a buncha buildings, Brothers and Sisters -- Nossir. Our town is fie. Good, God- fearing souls. Pure and hopeful. And the devil can't never take that away... Ella and Doc tend to WOUNDED PEOPLE in a triage area as.. Meacham finds his overturned PULPIT. Determination in his he pushes it UPRIGHT:

dialogues.speaker: AND NOW WE CATCH UP TO WHERE MEACHANL'S VOICE 1S_CQMING F
dialogues.text: He's standing on the pulpit in the rubble, his words a sermon/call-to-arms -- every survivor GATHERED AROUND:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In times of darkness, God asks that we come together so we may stand and fight. So we're goin' after our kin. Any of you aren't able or prepared, no shame in it. Head up to Fort Huachuca, join up with the garrison there and pray... Rest of us ride out at sun-up to recover that which we have lost. SUNRISE: Pistol chambers SPINNNN -- rifles are COCKED --

dialogues.speaker: MEACHAM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thy will be done, Lord, and there's an amen behind it. Lo and behold, most of the town survivors are just too da scared. They form an EXODUS LINE, heading off toward the Dolarhyde, Colorado and his REMAINING MEN (6) load the AL CORPSE onto the back of a WAGON. Some of them trade glanc DAMN WORRIED about staying. Dolarhyde sees it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody got something to say? His withering GLARE keeps them from speaking up. Doc and Meacham climb onto the wagon:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we need to bring that thing along? Doc nods as he TWISTS the forceps in the Alien's eye, the COMPASS HOLOGRAM flickering to life before them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this arrow points me back to Maria? Yeah -- J'm sure. Emmett appears leading a PONY, a BOW and quiver of ARROWS around his back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't come, Emmett, too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can protect myself -- shoot, I'm the only master bowman in my archery club. Won the county tournament by shootin' a flipped nickel at 50 paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' tells me these things don't carry nickels, son. Answers's no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to ride off with the chickenshits, then double back, be happy to. But let's just skip that part and get to it, Padre. And that's the truth. Meacham sighs, no choice... finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go fill your canteen, dammit. He SLAPS the reins and the wagon rides off. Emmett GRINS mounts the pony, then sees... JAKE riding past. ANGRY EYE Ella as she heels her horse and TROTS OFF angrily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Happy. But HAPPY remains, torn between them, tail wagging and lo up at Jake as if to say: PLEASE COME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up. Suppressing GUILT, he rides on toward the hills -- as Dol VEERS his horse in front of Jake, cutting him off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was ridin' into town to kill you for what you done to my son. You owe me your life, Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ride with us, we'll call it square. His hand rests on his nickel-plated .38. Eyes gleaming cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You that fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- WHOOSH: Jake's hand is already UP with his own PISTOL, drawn before Dolarhyde can finish his sentence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you owe me y.Q= life. We're square. In a DAZZLING TWIRL, Jake slaps it back in his holster. P made, he RIDES ON. Dolarhyde, burning mad at having been drawn, turns to CULOBAI)U -- speaks LOW:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow him. Soon as he's got his back turned... kill him.
Shit. Colorado hesitates. Dolar GLARES: "Do it." Finally Colorado NODS acquiescence, moves off... JAKE -- on the OUTSKIRTS of town now -- riding past Meach Doc on the WAGON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure out which way you're headed yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West. Saguaro Pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I meant. The inference LANDS on Jake. But he's in no mood. GALLOPS Meacham watches Jake go... MUSIC RISES AS WE DISSOLVE THR

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: A man running from his demons, or maybe toward them... th plains and pasturage... until he sees the tilted ROAD SIG "SAGUARO PASS." Up ahead, he sees DEBRIS... Part of a ROOF, lying broken on the ground. Pieces of a S CHIMNEY. Jake comes over a rise... to REVEAL:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DESTROYED LOG CABIN. Walls partially TORN AWAY. Somethi Jake is DEEPLY STIRRED. Dismounts, tentatively... walks u the PORCH. Boots CRUNCH over broken window glass as they

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHT BEAMS stream in. Eerie quiet. Jake takes it in, HAUNTED. Something CRUNCHES under his b DRIED FLOWERS. Sticking out from an OVERTURNED CRACKED VA Jake BLINKS, affected -- Bends over, TOUCHES the VASE AS: MEMORY FLASECUT! FRESH FLOWERS in a woman's hand... THE W FROM JAKE'S PICTURE. She smiles at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have. She turns, drops the flowers into the vase as we see she' talking to JAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you somethin' else.
CLINK -- He drops a LEATHER POUCH on the table next to th A FEW GOLD COINS clink out. The woman turns to him, WORRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think? The woman looks to the pouch -- Picks up one of the coins TORN. Jake moves behind her. Close. An INTIMACY here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boys '11 come after you. ON JAKE. Dark. But DETERMINED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let 'em come. She turns to him, their eyes HOLD... and they KISS. Soft. Tender. Soulful. But then -- a THUNDERCRACK turns their attention to the w A STORM CLOUD on the horizon. Same kind that consumed the The cabin starts to VIBRATE like a tuning fork. The pouch slides off the table... THE GOLD COINS SPILL OUT and --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: REELING. What is this memory? Who the hell is the woman? Something GLINTS in the far wall where the chimney used t

dialogues.speaker: ONE OF THE GOLD COINS
dialogues.text: EMBEDDED in the wood. Jake pulls it out of the wall, a th questions in his eyes. Sunlight SHIMMERS off it and -- MEMORY FLASHCUT! The spilled coins start SLIDING across t floor all by themselves, as if magnetically drawn to THE -- WHOOSH! -- SUCKED right up into it by some VACUUM FORC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?!!!

dialogues.speaker: WINDOWS EXPLODE
dialogues.text: FORCE AS ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT CRASHES IN! The Woman SCREAMS

dialogues.speaker: PULLING HER INTO THE LIGHT --
dialogues.text: She manages to GRAB a doorknob and DANGLES UPWARD, CHOKIN

A DEMONIC SILHOUETTE drops in front of them! JESUS!! Jake draws his pistol and FIRES! The demon SHRIEKS IN RAGE as SPIKED PLUMES fan out from i huge, elongated skull... making it look like a SILHOUETTE It QIAГЇВїВЅ1.-L 2 A T EI! R HEADDRESS! Its HIDEOUS FACE comes into the light -- AN AIJIE -- as i raises its arm, wearing a WRIST BRACELET that reshapes in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE DIVES AWAY but a searing pulse RIPS A WICKED GASH in side (now we know how he woke up with it in the desert) -

dialogues.speaker: THE PULSE PASSES THROUGH JAKE AND HITS THE WOMAN SQUARE I
dialogues.text: C-Mr-M. She 's HURLED backward into the wall, Jake. CRIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice! As he RUSHES to her, her collar UNLOCKS... and FLIES AT J clamping HE'S PULLED INTO THE LIGHT, CHOKING, SCREAMING -

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: As he STUMBLES back -- GASPING -- touching his neck -- Catches his breath. ROCKED. Sees "Alice's" BLOOD STAIN on wall. His shaking hand reaches out, brushes over it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying out the name) "Alice"... Whoever she was to him, he feels sledgehammered with GRIE he knows is, it was THEM. The creatures killed her. And t revelation... well, it galvanizes him with RAGE. Rage that gives him NEW PURPOSE... then--

dialogues.speaker: AT COLORADO, IN THE DOORWAY BEHIND HIM AIMING A GUN
dialogues.text: The stone HITS Colorado as he FIRES, the bullet tears PAS -- as Colorado recovers, Jake BODYSLAMS HIM -- the GUN go flying, they go hurling THROUGH THE WALL -- LANDING HARD other side -- aaballs-out. messy. close-quarter death mat Jake takes a PUNCH -- Colorado LOOPS an arm around his th YANKS -- they TUMBLE/SLAM to the floor, Jake LANDING on t Colorado who holds the arm lock, CHOKING THE LIFE OUT OF

Jake -- EYES POPPING -- SEES THE GUN just out of reach -- fingers GRASP for it -- seconds before he PASSES OUT He GRABS the gun and swings it back -- BLAMMII!Colorado R aside as the WALL where his head just was BLOWSOPEN--and Jake's ON HIM, PISTOL WHIPPING HIM MERCILESSLYuntilheSPIN the gun back around and POINTS IT between Colorado's eyes ON JAKE -- quaking with rage -- he wants to kill this guy he can taste it... but something's HOLDING HIM BACK -- GR teeth, COCKS the trigger and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we CUT WIDE on the cabin as a GUNSHOT CRACKS. A flock BIRDS screech into the sky from the overgrown corn field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of our people RIDE along, following the ever-til HOLOGRAPHIC ARROW, their COMPASS, floating from the dead eye in the back of the wagon. Greavey, Dolar's ranch hand, heels up to ELLA. COCKY SWAG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what's a pretty lady like y--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you finish that sentence, I shoot you in your beef whistle. Doc, sipping from his canteen, does a SPIT TAKE. Ella's e DRILL Greavey. Cut down a peg, he tips his hat, red-faced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am. And rides past her, taking us to EMMETT and DOLARHYDE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me somethin', Kid... why didn't your father just take my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: offered him a thousand dollars to leave town. He could's taken you outta harm's way, relocated... found you a new momma. And this just BURNS Emmett. A beat; then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true Percy's momma died givin' birth to him, Mister Dolarhyde? Something FLASHES in Dolarhyde. But he's contained:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe you should use that thousand dollars to buy yourself a new wife. Emmett HOLDS his look against Dolarhyde's. Brave and UNFLINCHING. Doc can't help but grin at the kid's moxie.. it's short-lived as his face suddenly falls:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madre Dios... And we PAN AROUND, dropping over his shoulder to see what reacting to -- AN ENORMOUS CRATER. ACRES WIDE... TWENTY FEET DEEP. Even Dolarhyde looks nervous now:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Winfield's Landing. They turn to see Meacham, brushing the DUST off a WOODEN Holds it UP. " Winfield's Landing... Population 133." ON GREAVEY AND THE MEN. Shit. He doesn't mean...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tryin' to tell me those... things pulled the whole damn town into the sky? And suddenly a weird CRACK shakes the canyon -- like the BARRIER BREAKING -- everyone's look goes UP where: SWIRLING, DARK CLOUDS LOOM. The same clouds that dropped tornado on Absolution. And that appeared in Jake's MEMORI the cabin. But this time, something's SHOT OUT from them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't be good. The plummeting object HITS a distant dune, kicking up a S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scatter.

-- everyone runs their horses aside as the object BOUNCES rocks -- then SLOWS... to a STOP. They STARE. Finally Dolarhyde kicks his horse forward slo DISMOUNTS, draws his GUN. What he sees is SHOCKING: It's an OVAL CAPSULE OF BLUE GOO, the outer layer some ki TRANSLUCENT COCOON. Suspended within the murky Jell-o is GE, DEC SHAPE. Motionless. UH-OH. The others draw guns too, converging around it in equal S and FEAR. But the thing doesn't MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we... open it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we open it? Hell NO we shouldn--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- oops -- -- and now we find Emmett's already POKING it with a stic Small TEAR in the cocoon's outer embryonic layer -- GOO l then it RUPTURES, EXPLODING as the horses REAR away, WHIN the goo spreads across the desert floor, thinning out. BEAT. Everyone wipes blue shit off their clothes as they FACE-TO-FACE with the object inside, lying there on the g A COW. YES, A COW. Motionless. DEAD, in fact. A METAL TUBE jammed in its mou connected to a VALVE in the now-flaccid bubble's outer sh Greavey notices a BRANDING on the cow's rump -- the lette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss... it's one'a yours. Dolarhyde's eyes NARROW. Emmett looks at Doc, SCARED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is-- is this what happened to my Pa? Doc dismounts. Moves to the cow's mouth and PULLS OUT THA with a wet SQUISHING sound. Thinking it through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was stuck down its throat... to help it breathe. That means they wanted to keep it alive, Emmett. (forces a small smile) I'm sure your father is fine. But Doc's eyes aren't sure. Meacham looks back to the sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd they dump it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever they needed from it, they must've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna get dark soon, need to keep moving. She does. The others FOLLOW in a chilled daze. The last i DOLARHYDE, glancing back at his dead cow with angry eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now our people APPEAR riding up a ridge... Dolarhyde shoo HAND, bringing the caravan to a STOP. Once again, SHOCK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-ly shit. BOOM UP to reveal a SURREAL SIGHT in the valley below: AGAMBLING RIVERBOAT. Nose buried in the sand, paddlewheel facing the sky, as if it'd been dropped from the clouds i desert. Just like that cow. Off their LOOKS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING alongside of the TILTED PADDLEBOAT, our team rid around it. Trying to make SENSE. STENCILED on the stern i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Colorado Queen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river's two hundred miles from here. But Ella doesn't seem as impressed as the rest of them. I fact, her attention is drawn BEHIND them, to something co over the DUNES... the barest flicker of a smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. IT'S JAKE ON HORSEBACK. Followed by another horse, with COLORADO in the saddle. Wrists tied but ALIVE. As Jake ri to a stop, he PUSHES Colorado off the horse -- the indian the ground with a THUD as Jake levels Dolarhyde with HARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man got it in his head that he was s'posed to kill me. I'm holding onto his ear 'til he says sorry.
As Colorado stumbles to his feet angrily, humiliated, Dol notices his BLOODY EAR. The LOBE has been SHOT OFF. He lo up at Jake, half-angry, half-EMBARRASSED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you let him live? Jake's hard-as-nails. DRIVEN now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna need him. He rides past Dolar to Ella. Stops. Says, simply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice boat. (then... SNIFFS) What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be me. He realizes her shirt's caked in the BLUE GOO from the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why're you blue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I missed ya. Their look HOLDS. A MOMENT. Something REAL between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We better keep movin'. A THUNDERCRACK. On the horizon, sheets of RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm's comin'. I say we dig in here til it passes. (to Colorado; fucking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that sound, Nat? Nat BURNS. Dolar feels his AUTHORITY being undermined:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm or no storm, I say we keep movin'. Colorado finally turns to Uolarhyde. DEFIANT:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too hard tracking anything in the rain.
Dolarhyde GLARES at Colorado, who GLARES BACK: his loyalt in QUESTION. The tide IS turning against the rancher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN POURS on the overturned boat. Horses tethered. The A CORPSE has been moved onto a slanted deck, covered by a T WE TILT TO THE ALIEN'S HAND. Poking out. Motionless. HOLD it, longer than we're comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RATTLESNAKE is coiled around a CHANDELIER... except the chandelier is on the floor and the floor is the CEILING. Upended gambling tables. WOODRATS scurry over FOOD. Every window's SMASHED... as if something just TOOK everyone. Dolar sits by a FIRE made from furniture parts, drinking WHISKEY FLASK. Colorado opposite, rubbing his MANGLED EAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low, eyes averted) Yeah. Dolar pours some whiskey on a BANDANA, leans towards Colo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme clean it for you or it'll get -- -- I'm fine. Dolarhyde backs away. Colorado GLARES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Is Percy worth dyin' for? Dolar's eyes flash. A mixture of anger and PAIN. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take care of my kin, Nat. ON COLORADO as that lands. Clearly, there's something her a bond that seems to go deeper than just boss and employe WHAT? Finally Nat just gets up and LEAVES. Dolar watches him go, takes a healthy SWIG. Hears a WHIMP Looks over and sees... EMMETT, huddled in a corner. CRYIN
ON DOLARHYDE. The kid's naked emotion AFFECTING him, but fact Dolar might have a conscience makes him ANGRY too. L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Kid. Emmett looks up, SNIFFLES. Dolar tosses him the WHISKEY F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a drink and shut p. He gets up, walks off. Leaving the kid with the flask. As Emmett looks at it confusedly, stuffs it in his POCKET --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meacham has set out TIN PANS under holes to collect RAIN Dumps a pan into his CANTEEN as Doc enters with COFFEE fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the tin plates) We brought enough water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for drinkin', it's for blessin'. Doc nods: ah. Turns to go... STOPS. Turns back. Intense e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Padre... Maria came to see you in confession every Sunday. It seemed... she had a lot to talk about. (beat, this is hard) Was she having an affair? Meacham removes his spectacles. Looks at Doc --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't say. And Doc DOES know. But there's a quiet DESPERATION here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I said to her... I... (shakes his head; then) Please. If I'm wrong about my wife... I don't want to die angry. Meacham sees the PAIN in his friend's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can ask Maria if she was cheatin' on you once we get her back. 'Til then? (bit of a grin) Don't die.
And OFF DOC, thunder CRACKS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN pours down through an open gash in the roof, splashi floor. Ella enters, glances back toward the door to make she's alone, then pulls off her shirt and folds it over a Upper body NAKED in the moonlight. We catch only a FLASH this, and for a moment it's PURE HOTNESS... . until she turns and something ELSE is revealed: criss- crossed LASH MARKS on her back. She turns away and starts to SPLASH herself with water, e the blue goo and dirt from her skin and face... then: A M ignites behind her. She WHIRLS, startled, covering her br with her arms -- JAKE is sitting in a chair at the Commod desk, casually lighting a cheroot in his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell,-re- you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mindin' my own business. (snaps out the match) Then you decided to take a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Givin' you privacy. She throws her shirt on, but her skin's wet and the shirt to her, celebrating her shape in a way that can't be igno Jake tosses her his jacket. As she slips it on, she notic bottle of WHISKEY on the table... and the PHOTOGRAPH OF A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . she's pretty. (Jake says NOTHING) Who was she? Jake's quiet. DARK. Intense emotion, intensely suppressed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: only thing I know's her name was Alice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's dead. Ella looks up at him. INTO him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you loved her. Jake shakes his head, sort of mumble/chuckles in RESISTAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you women are the same -- Always wanna make it about Goddamn "love."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Lonergan. I'm not the same. There is a force -- a strength about this woman -- that h connects with. But remains, true to character, ALOOF:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't matter. She takes a step closer. Soft. Intimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what dj= matter? Jake just looks at her. Then, lifts the cheroot to his li the FLARE of its tip casting him in a demonic light...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What matters is I find the thing that killed her. (dark as hell) And make it pay. And now, he leans forward with a focused LOOK... holds up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you see this before? A beat. Ella -- somehow CONTAINED -- opens her mouth to l But he cuts her off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and don't lie to me. You wouldn't've asked me if you didn't recognize it. Ella tightens. PAIN in her eyes. And Jake REALIZES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things... they the ones who put those marks on your back? She swallows: a mixture of SHAME that he's found her out. ANGER at what was done to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took my people. Destroyed where I'm from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North of here. Been trackin' 'em ever since, town to town. Best I figure, they're hidin' in a mine. Jake CONSIDERS all this. Softens a little:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you'd told me the truth instead of throwin' rocks at me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what, you would've stuck around? Bullshit. I couldn't've turned you away from what you had to do, any more than I could've stopped these people from going after their kin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth ain't worth a damn, Jake... and we're gonna need all the guns we can get. Their look HOLDS... until Jake SMIRKS. Likes her style:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's the only reason you wanted me to come with you? Cause of my gun? There's a pause... then Ella SMIRKS back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you do with it. Among the many things these two ate feeling -- both separ and together -- the one that pops right now is ATTRACTION Confusing as it is for him. The pregnant moment LINGERS.. Until Happy suddenly starts to GROWWWWL, sensing somethin outside. ANOTHER CRACK OF THUNDER as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horses STAMP NERVOUSLY out the window as Greavey and rest of Dolarhyde's men (COBBETT and 4 others) HUDDLE in conference -- whispers that sound a lot like MUTINY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell're we doin' here? We should be ridin' in the opposite direction of those things --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do that, the old man's likely to shoot us himself. Only way outta this is -- And suddenly. Greavey SNIFFS the air, FROWNS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . what's that smell? -- as they TURN to the deck where the creature lays... AL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES, illuminating the ship -- and als4THE A behind them. a coiled mass clinging spiderlike to the cei Its arm WHIPS out, noosing around Cobbett -- LIFTS HIM of feet -- SLAMS HIM into the ceiling -- TOSSES HIM like a r The men SHOUT -- a PAIR OF RAZOR SHARP CANINES extrude fr alien then it SPRINGS -- SLICING THROUGH TWO MEN AT ONCE GREAVEY and 2 others manage to SCRAMBLE AWAY:

dialogues.speaker: JAKE AND ELLA
dialogues.text: HEAR the SCREAMS -- Happy takes off -- they RACE after hi

dialogues.speaker: DOC AND MEACHAM
dialogues.text: Hear them too -- grabs their PISTOLS -- and Doc, his CANT DQIRHXPE_. 9oWQ n Colorado snatches up a WINCHESTER, LOADS IT, throws anoth to Dolar -- who's suddenly, surprisingly, PROTECTIVE of E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get behind me, Boy -- THE ALIEN SPRINGS INTO THE ROOM -- landing upside down on ceiling. Dolar FIRES at it --

dialogues.speaker: RUN, KID
dialogues.text: Emmett SCRAMBLES down a FLOOR HATCH, disappears as Dolar FIRING -- but the alien BATS the gun away and LIFTS Dolar

Paralyzed with FEAR, he EXHALES a terrified GASP and -- THE CREATURE RECOILS FROM HIS BREATH! HURLS Dolar aside - THROUGH THE FIRE -- embers catch CURTAINS and FLAMES SPRE COLORADO races in, throws a TOMAHAWK -- it PINS the alien to the wall, the monster SHRIEKS as Nat draws a PISTOL bu The alien SPITS A STICKY RESIN GOB -- it HARDENS, pinning hand with the pistol to the wall in return. He STRUGGLES alien ADVANCES -- BOOM! The Alien's shoulder EXPLODES ORANGE FLUORESCENT BL a GUNSHOT rings out -- it's Dolarhyde, back on his feet a FIRING -- the monster SCREECHES and leaps down, DISAPPEAR through the hatch where Emmett fled --

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMMITT
dialogues.text: And the fire's GROWING around the boat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMMETT moves FAST on hands-and-knees through a narrow CRA -- around a corner here -- another there -- a MAZE --

dialogues.speaker: SOMEWHERE BEHIND HIM
dialogues.text: EMMETT -- reaches another HATCH -- pushes through and OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- DROPPING onto the floor -- as we WHIP TO Jake racing i around a corner -- but suddenly: THE ALIEN BURSTS FROM TH

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND EMMETT, SWEEPING HIM UP IN ITS CLUTCHES
dialogues.text: Jake's bracelet OPENS UP into that BLASTER and it's AIMED Alien but the creature CUPS a hand around Emmett and LIFT off the floor, a TALONED FINGER pressed to the boy's THRO STANDOFF. ELLA rushes in. The creature sees her -- HISSES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know if you understand me... but you hurt that boy and I hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: HELL, DEMON
dialogues.text: Meacham brings his CANTEEN down like a HATCHET, SPRAYING alien with HOLY WATER... but NOTHING happens! And then -- The Alien STRIKES -- SLAMMING MEACHAM BACK INTO A JUTTING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien SPRINGS through a doorway, TAKING EMMETT WITH I Ella RUSHES after it as Jake RUNS to Meacham, hanging imp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, now... Don't move, dammit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after the boy... then you get our people back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking. DQW! GET YOUR ASS-- But Meacham GRABS Jake, EYE TO EYE. GASPING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up... 'cause I'm not gonna be able to say it again -- (pulls Jake CLOSE) God don't care who you were, Son... only who you Mg. ON JAKE. AFFECTED. With a last RASP, Meacham DIES just as races through the growing FLAMES -- REACTS -- no time to

dialogues.speaker: JAKE
dialogues.text: But Jake can't let go -- FURY -- HEARTBREAK -- Doc PULLS away -- Jake SNAGS THE CRUCIFIX off Meacham's neck as he' forced OUT, leaving Meacham's body to be CONSUMED BY FLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat is a BALL OF FIRE in the pouring rain, as what r of our heroes stumble out, COUGHING, devastated... Jake, Dolarhyde, Colorado, Greavey, 2 GUNMEN... and Ella and Ha atop a DUNE, following a TRAIL OF FLUORESCENT ORANGE BLOO streaking into the desert. Happy BARKING MADLY. Ella drop a knee, touches the orange blood as it WASHES AWAY in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing... was dead... it was d-ead... DOLARHYDE, RAIN pouring down his face... VULNERABLE and G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't stop it -- It just... grabbed the kid. ON JAKE. Rage-filled against the flames... Meacham's CRUC in his hared, as his FIST closes around it. Looks up, HAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'd better get him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STALACTITES loom from the ceiling -- BAM! EMMETT is DROPP the floor of a sinister cave -- scrambles back from THE A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. You are one ugly bastar-- PSST! The alien spits a RESIN GOB on Emmett's mouth -- PS PSST! More gobs PIN his limbs to the wall. Emmett can't m can't speak -- eyes WIDE and TERRIFIED -- The creature looks down at an ARMOR PLATE on its bicep. T a series of keys and the armor spits out what looks like. .. a small RUBIK'S CUBE made of some alien alloy. The creature casually TOSSES IT in the air where it FLOAT starts to SPIN -- as it does, its sides FLIP AND TURN (li Rubik's Cube) -- emitting HIGH-PITCHED SONAR BEEPS: This thing's some kind of HOMING BEACON. Off Emmett's WIDE, GAPING EYES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our people RIDE FAST against the rising sun, on the hunt Emmett. Colorado REARS his horse, kneels by a trace of OR BLOOD on some rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks off --) West. Greavey and the others share a LOOK. E o Turn to Dolar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, only took one of them things to kill four of us. We got no chance here. Dolarhyde BURNS -- knowing he's being ABANDONED --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a goddamn coward. (to the others) You work for me, dammit. You're my m e 1 1 Qyees. And Greavey, finally FREE to speak his mind, says SPITEFU

dialogues.text: Fine line between a coward and a fool. The men turn tail and RIDE AWAY. Dolarhyde SHOUTS after t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all FIRED! Doc takes the opportunity to TWIST the knife:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like they finally found something to be more scared of than you. Dolarhyde feels his world CRUMBLING away man by man... Ella trots alongside Jake, who's staring at that DARK CLO overhead with a bad feeling:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds've been moving east since sun- up... 'cept that one. ON ELLA. We SENSE she knows something, something more she saying. SNAPS her reins and they RIDE OFF:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the group gallops into a BOX CANYON, Happy starts BARK MADLY -- the horses SLOW --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAMBLAN1111 GUNSHOTS from above suddenly PEPPER the grou the horses REAR and KICK UP, startled -- A DOZEN FIGURES ON THE CLIFFS ALL AROUND THEM. Badass OUT with RIFLES aimed at our heroes. One of them CALLS DOWN:

dialogues.speaker: SHIT.
dialogues.text: SLOWLY, Jake draws his gun... tosses it. Now the rest of As they SEE -- TWO RIDERS -- incoming -- from the other e the canyon. Rifles aimed and ready. Happy GROWLS... One of the outlaws knocks back the hammer on his rifle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we just shoot 'em and take their-- But the words catch in his throat as his EYES WIDEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: . Boss? Sure enough, they're looking right at (BRONC -JAKE. Both outlaws and HUNT) lower their guns, hostility replaced by SURPRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you doin' back here, Lonergan? Oh, Christ. This is JAKE'S gang. ON DOLARHYDE. ELLA. COLORADO. All registering it. And JAKE, of course, doesn' REMEMBER these men as Bronc dismounts, NERVOUS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Boss... Creek's gonna shit when he sees you. (then; re: the others) And who the hell're they? ON JAKE. Now does he handle this? Ht:nt rides up next to SUSPICIOUS, and for reasons yet to be known, UNFRIENDLY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Jake. Cat got your--? SMACKI Jake moves LIGHTNING FAST, SLAPS Hunt across the f stopping the question on his tongue -- CATCHES the gun as drops and presses the barrel into Hunt's NECK:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when're Qy the one asking the goddamned questions!?! Ella and our people REACT as Jake plays it up, beat defen good OFFENSE. The outlaws are SCARED: this is the Lonerga know. Hunt holds his BLOODY MOUTH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Jake... You broke my tooth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit whining. Now bring me to the rest of the boys, if that meets with your goddamn approval. Bronc and Hunt nod, mounting up, SHOUTING to the OUTLAWS

dialogues.speaker: LONERGAN'S BACK. MEET US AT THE CAMP
dialogues.text: As they RIDE OFF, Dolarhyde looks to Jake and mutters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice company you keep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell're you doing? If we don't catch up to that kid, we're never gonna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They called me "Boss." You wanna go after these things with five or fifty? (off her look) Like you said: we can use every gun we can get. Qh. That actually makes SENSE. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly're you gonna say to 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you when I figure it out. And he SPURS onward, leaving her to follow uneasily --

dialogues.speaker: RUBIK'S CUBE
dialogues.text: OUR ALIEN HANGS UPSIDE DOWN from stalactites by four spin limbs. Mid sleep cycle. And inches below its head... EMMETT, still webbed to the wall. Unable to move or speak TERRIFIED. As suddenly... the cube DEACTIVATES. And DROPS THE CREATURE'S EYES SNAP OPEN. It SPRINGS from the ceilin FOUR DARK SHAPES blot out light, GLIDING IN...

A gang of FOUR MORE ALIENS dismounts. The biggest and STR -- their LEADER -- barks GUTTURAL CLICKS at the alien who kidnapped Emmett. Kidnapper explaining as it removes anot STRANGE DEVICE. The device beams a HOLO-PROJECTION... OF ELLA'S FACE! The aliens HISS in furious RECOGNITION. JESUS... is this some kind of otherworldly WANTED POSTER? PLUMES fan out angrily from the Leader's HUGE, ELONGATED like an indian headdress! The creature TURNS to Emmett -- It's the alien who killed Jake's woman! We'll come to kno as... THE SLAVER. It MOVES OMINOUSLY for Emmett, grasping the HANDLE of som that UNCOILS with fluid, frightening speed: A WHITE-HOT LASER WHIP. This will be The Slaver's SIGNATU WEAPON. It spirals to its full length, FLASHING out at -- EMMETT -- MUFFLED SCREAM! But... the whip DOESN'T cut him instead it SLICES THROUGH THE WEBBING that pins the boy t wall. As Emmett FALLS, The Slaver SWEEPS HIM UP -- Emmett FLAILS, punching, kicking to no avail -- but then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tumbles from Emmett's pocket and SPLASHES WHISKEY on The -- IT.. S[iRIEM WILDLI-Aa THE BOOZE CONTACTS FLESH, SKIN EMMETT -- tumbles away. Terror turns to REVELATION as he the webbing from his mouth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy SHIT. Another alien LUNGES for the kid but Emmett SPLASHES him the flask -- the alien RECOILS, flesh BUBBLING -- Emmett whirls -- sees the HOVERBIKES -- JUMPS onto one, t desperately at the controls --- IiON-DO , ГЇВїВЅ'T THIS T WO ?!! Another Alien SCUTTLES in FAST -- Emmett's scrambl boots slide into the foot supports, which automatically W CLOSED as the bike THROTTLES FORWARD... DECAPITATING THE The bike SPINS UNCONTROLLABLY, plasma thrusters SCORCHING and setting two more aliens ABLAZE! The speeder KAMIKAZE BOUNCES out of the cavern at 90 MPH, Emmett screaming! The Slaver SCREECHES FURIOUSLY as the remaining creatures back on their speeders and GIVE CHASE!

Climbing onto an old desert stump -- BLAM! It's SHOT OFF couple DRUNK OUTLAWS, swigging booze from STOLEN WHISKEY piled on a WAGON. We're in an OUTLAW CAMP: roughly 40 fas and saddle tramps. Tents. Horses. Ample weapons. And righ now, most of them are GEARING UP to ride out for some rea One of them, CREEK JOHNSON, with a chewed up face like sw cheese, slides a RIFLE into his saddle and shouts to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey --- ГЇВїВЅs 4 Lay off that whiskey and saddle up. Flyer's on its way and we best damn be sober for it.

dialogues.speaker: HUNT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Creek turns; sees HUNT and BRONC crest the hill with the OUTLAWS from the cliffs. ANGRILY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Bout time you got back. (re: Hunt's bloody nose) What the hell happened to you?!? Hunt nods over his shoulder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did. The outlaws part to reveal JAKE, riding in with Ella and rest of our people. Creek's eyes NARROW, NOT happy to see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: well, shit. It gets very, VERY QUIET. Our people tread warily, knowin whatever reaction Jake's eliciting, it AIN'T GOOD. He run gaunt of ACCUSING GLARES. Smart enough to know that CREEK the man in charge. Dismounts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look happy to see me, Creek. Creek eyes him. TOUGH. Clearly, HISTORY here:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fixin' to rob us a train in about twenty minutes and you come ridin' in like nothin' ever happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Lonergan. I ain't happy to see you. ON JAKE. How to navigate bad blood that he doesn't REMEMB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm sure you'll get over it. Then, pretty much DISMISSING Creek, Jake turns, addresses rest of the men. If he's their boss? HГЇВїВЅ _gQDn&.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you, Boys, but we're not going after a train -- We're going after something else. The men seem... . CONFUSED. Not sure what the hell is GOI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jake... you-- you said you didn't wanna be in charge no more. And this is a REVELATION. Jake glances at ELLA -- has to IMPROVISING to hold his ground:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I-- changed my mind. So saddle the hell up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going anywhere with you. Creek's heard enough. Strides forward, a direct CHALLENGE

dialogues.speaker: CREEK JOHNSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got some balls on you -- walkin' outta here a week ago sayin' what you said and doin' what you did and then ridin' back in here and givin orders. Just who the hell do you think you are? The IRONY of the question isn't lost on Jake, as Creek wa right up to Ella. CLOSE. Violates her space: studies her a mixture of curiosity and CONTEMPT.

dialogues.speaker: CREEK JOHNSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So. Are you her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whore Jake quit this gang for. OH. Another piece of the puzzle falls into place -- Jake' SNAP to Ella as they both REALIZE... the men think she's " e." Jake does his best to stay cool, meets Creek's star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your mouth, Creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what? These boys are with = now. jID in charge. You may be fast, but you are goddamned outgunned. ON JAKE. OUR HEROES. Shit. Jake turns to the men --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That a fact, Boys? But Creek doesn't wait for them to respond:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your guns on the whore. He so much as twitches, blow her brains out her ear. AT ONCE, 10 GUNS ARE LEVELED AT ELLA'S HEAD. No doubt as the men are LOYAL to. But Jake locks into Creek, UNFLINCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call her a whore again, that'll be the last word you ever say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ain't in no position to make threats, asshole. Hunt: take his gun. Hunt reluctantly scrambles over to Jake, oh-so-carefully the PISTOL from Jake's holster:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Boss... nothin' personal. Creek now turns to BULL MCCADE, roughly the size of a BAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him down, Bull. And Jake barely has time to react as Bull lets fly with a JAWBREAKING HAYMAKER that about knocks Jake out of his BO Dolarhyde and Colorado WINCE as Jake hits the dirt with a Creek striding over, cock of the walk, LEANS over him:

dialogues.speaker: CREEK JOHNSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where the hell's our gold. Jake? "Gold?" Jake SPITS BLOOD, defiant:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
